page.title: 20DURDAR,WREAY,BRISCO ET AL
page.content: This area is thinly populated.The only villages are;Durdar,a small dormitory village with an inn and a petrol station,Wreay,another small dormitory village with a church,school,village hall and inn,Brisco and Burnthwaite, both very small farming communities. The name{DURDAR}comes from the Gaelic words "doire durach" meaning 'oak_ copse'(the Inglewood Forest once used to cover the whole of this area.The name{BRISCO}also comes from the Gaelic "bierce sceaga" meaning 'birch copse'. {BURNTHWAITE}means 'burnt clearing'. {WREAY}comes from variations of "petrelwra" meaning 'corner of land by the river Petteril' { XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX} This survey was done by:_Mark Boyle, Anne Gallagher,Gillian Bell,Stuart Beattie,Stuart Chandler,Nicola Light_ Burn,Claire Sherrard & Andrea Warwick.
